Coral Island  self-describes as a "reimagining of farming games", but if we're being real it doesn't reimagine the Stardew Valley template totally differently. The titular island, and your overgrown plot of farmland on it, has almost the same layout as Stardew Valley, and the tasks you do - growing stuff, keeping animals, making friends with locals, exploring a mine five levels at a time, and appeasing local spirits by giving them bundles of different crops - will also be very familiar to any DewHeads (that's what we call ourselves).
That's not to say Coral Island isn't good. It's all in very beautiful bouncy 3D, for one thing, and I found the island setting (which impacts the flora, fauna, and architecture in general) made everything feel less like work. Combined with a thread of environmentalism weaving through the game, and the fact that Coral Island is slightly easier than Stardew Valley, and you feel like you're doing more progress in less time. If you loved the vibe of ConcernedApe's smash hit, but found the need to hand-write your own almanac a bit intimidating, this is the game for you.
Read more
articles.title: Coral Island early access review: a pretty Stardew-like that makes farming a little easier

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Capcom are making literal big bad Lady Dimitrescu a wee bit shorter for Resident Evil Village’s The Mercenaries Additional Orders DLC, out later this month. Game director Kento Kinoshita told Polygon that although playable Lady D is still taller than any other character in Mercenaries, she’s been shortened to “a little under nine feet tall” from her canon height of around nine feet six inches. Kinoshita also went into some detail about Additional Orders’ other characters, including punch-maestro Chris Redfield.

 
Read more
articles.title: Lady Dimitrescu is losing some height in Resident Evil Village’s Mercenaries DLC

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Update: It looks like the UK's 512GB deal and the US's 1TB deal are no longer available. Boo, but also, the 400GB model is now on sale, so I've replaced the former with this mid-sized card in the lists below. I've also updated the 256GB SanDisk Ultra's price, as it's dropped slightly further. The otherwise original version of the article is as follows...

In case you missed the mega-guide that went up earlier, today marks the start of Amazon’s Prime Early Access Sale: a two-day buffet of discounts that’s exclusive to Prime members. That includes loads on PC gaming hardware, though my eyes were most immediately caught by something not very desktop-grade at all. The SanDisk Ultra, one of the best microSD cards for the Steam Deck, is on sale across a choice of capacities – with the 1TB model getting especially juicy >50% savings in both the UK and US. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Today’s Prime Early Access Sale makes the best-value Steam Deck microSD card even cheaper

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
You could see world-famous ballkickers Messi, Pogba, and Neymar battling in Modern Warfare 2 later this year if a Call Of Duty leaker’s claims are on the money. TheGhostOfHope has tweeted a list of what they say are upcoming operators for the military FPS sequel, launching later this month. Among the other spots are a potential return for the controversial Roze skin, and Call Of Duty: Infinite Warfare’s protagonist Nick Reyes.

 
Read more
articles.title: Call Of Duty leaker claims footballers are lined up to be Modern Warfare 2 operators

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
If you're a fan of MOBAs but aren't a fan of battling other human beings over the internet, then Vela Games' Evercore Heroes may pique your interest. It's a competitive PVE game where teams of heroes fight it out to finish a dungeon run the fastest. And having seen a brief presentation of it behind closed doors, it looks like a good time - albeit one taking heavy inspiration from its main competitors.
Read more
articles.title: Evercore Heroes is a MOBA where teams race to finish dungeons the fastest

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Welcome, prospective hardware acquirers, to the second and final day of the Amazon Prime Early Access Sale. Like Prime Day, this sale requires a Prime membership to access all the best deals, but so far those have included some tempting savings on some quality PC gaming kit. It therefore marks a good chance to replace any worn-out peripherals or make a component upgrade, especially if it can't wait until Black Friday 2022. I’ve rounded up a few dozen of the choicest deals, from Amazon UK and Amazon US, below. 
Read more
articles.title: Best Amazon Prime Early Access Sale PC gaming deals - day 2

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
A DDoS attack on Blizzard caused issues for Overwatch 2 players earlier today, following on from similar attacks on the company during the free to play shooter’s launch last week. The latest attack came just after Overwatch 2 had finished a period of emergency maintenance. Although Blizzard have confirmed the DDoS attack has now ended, the recurring attacks aren’t exactly a good sign for a game already beset by technical issues.

 
Read more
articles.title: Blizzard and Overwatch 2 struck by third DDoS attack in a week

articles.author: CJ Wheeler
articles.description:
Time-bending sci-fi shooter Deathloop is one of the possible futures of the Dishonored universe, Arkane’s Dinga Bakaba revealed during a recent episode of the Xbox podcast. Bakaba was the creative director on Deathloop, and lead designer for Dishonored 2 and Dishonored: Death Of The Outsider. He’s finally spilled the tea, confirming players’ suspicions that the two Arkane series beginning with a D and featuring magical abilities are linked.

 
Read more
articles.title: Deathloop takes place in the same world as Dishonored, creative director confirms

articles.author: Will Judd
articles.description:
Over at Walmart in the US, you can pick up a set of Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 Bluetooth PC speakers for $59, rather than the $95 they normally cost. This is a better deal than I expected to find for this model, which offer a small but powerful 100W subwoofer and two speakers with 'exclusive horn-loaded tweeter technology'. No, I don't know what that means either.  
Read more
articles.title: Get some rather excellent Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 Bluetooth PC speakers for $59

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
If I remember correctly, Action Man: Raid On Island X dropped out of a cereal box. This was back when cereal had that Happy Meal generosity, and you'd look forward to that thump as a gift caked in dust landed in your bowl. You won't find any game demos in those wheat crunchie crumbs anymore.
Definitely not one on the level of Action Man: Raid On Island X at least. It was the absolute business.
Read more
articles.title: Have You Played... Action Man: Raid On Island X?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Canonical se rozhodla poskytnout zdarma svůj program podpory Ubuntu Pro. Bezplatně je možné jej užívat do pěti instalací, což pokrývá jednotlivce či malé firmy. Jak přesně si Ubuntu Pro pořídit?
articles.title: Návod: jak použít Ubuntu Pro zdarma a zajistit si tak desetiletou podporu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: SIMD operace, s jejichž některými variantami určenými pro platformu x86–64 jsme se seznámili minule, se používají i na RISCových procesorech. Dnes se seznámíme s rozšířením NEON pro procesory ARM.
articles.title: Podpora SIMD (vektorových) instrukcí na RISCových procesorech

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: Podíváme se s drony do oblak, s Toyotou se koukneme na úniky osobních údajů a s aplikací YoWhatsApp vyrazíme za trojskými koňmi. Představíme si také na kritickou chybu v produktech Fortinetu a nějaký ten malware.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: využití dronů k útokům na sítě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Nadcházející vydání linuxové distribuce Debian 14 ponese kódové jméno „Forky“. Firma Juno Computers uvedla na trh Juno Tablet s Linuxem. Společnost Google oznámila zahájení vývoje otevřeného operačního systému KataOS.
articles.title: Debian 14 bude „Forky“, Google oznámil nový operační systém KataOS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Když před zhruba dvěma roky konečně vyšla norma C++ verze 20, těšil jsem se, jako asi každý, jak si osahám a vyzkouším nové vlastnosti, které měly posunout jazyk zase trošku dál do budoucnosti.
articles.title: Jak na korutiny v C++20

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojová verze Wine 7.19, rychlejší sdílení souborů mezi hostem a hostitelem s 9P VirtIO v Linuxu 6.1, /e/OS 1.4 konečně s vlastním telefonem Murena One, Linux do budoucna patrně bez Intel ICC.
articles.title: Vyšel Ardour 7.0, Blender slaví 20 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Stále více a více technologií, po kterých jsme před 30 lety prahli, dnes leží někde v prachu zapomenuto. Nebo se prodávají jako retro zboží za šílené částky. Proč opouštíme staré známe pro nové?
articles.title: Technologie 20. století odcházejí: jak nám bude bez VHS, DVD, CD a disket?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Hrach)
articles.description: Ukážeme si, jak si spustit server OpenVPN a použít ho mimo jiné pro zveřejnění nějaké služby (například SSH) na nějakém stroji za NATem. To je bohužel běžná konfigurace většiny sítí bez veřejných IP adres.
articles.title: Nastavení OpenVPN pro přístup na stroje za NATem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Havlíček)
articles.description: Při provozu dvou datových center jsme se 15 let spoléhali na jediného poskytovatele konektivity. Kvůli růstu naší zákaznické báze musela přijít architektonická změna. Stali jsme se autonomním systémem.
articles.title: Sám sobě poskytovatelem aneb jak jsme se stali autonomním systémem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda od světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si vyzkoušíme nástroj na spouštění úloh, přidáme si zvukové efekty do živého vysílání, změříme si dobu trvání naší práce a vytvoříme si zástupce aplikací.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (12. 10. 2022): sledování času stráveného při práci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nový Firefox umožňuje svou interní čtečkou (toto slovo si odteď škrtněme) už i upravovat PDF soubory – včetně textů, kreseb či přidávání podpisů. Na platformě Windows pak může vedle výchozího prohlížeče sloužit i jako výchozí program pro otevírání PDF souborů, na této platformě pak i lze k hlavní liště (ve Windows 10 a 11) připnout privátní okna.
articles.title: Firefox 106 s podporou úprav PDF souborů a vylepšeními WebRTC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze The Amnestic Incognito Live System nepřináší žádné velké novinky, aktualizuje však jádro a prohlížeč s pošťákem. Nově tak v Tailsu 5.5 najdeme LTS Linux 5.10.140, dále pak Tor Browser 11.5.4 a Thunderbird to 102.3.0.
articles.title: Tails 5.5 aktualizuje jádro, Firefox i Thundebrird

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Humble Bundle pořádá další akci, při které je tentokrát možné získat celou řadu knih od vydavatelství Packt. Dostupné jsou knihy a video kurzy o nejrůznějších programovacích jazycích: Java, C++, Python, Go, Rust, Julia a Ruby. Balík obsahuje informace pro všechny, od úplných začátečníků přes vysokoškolské studenty až po zkušené experty, kteří si chtějí zdokonalit své dovednosti.
articles.title: Humble Tech Book Bundle: spousta programátorských knih z vydavatelství Packt

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Datová schránka měla být od příštího roku automaticky vytvořena všem fyzickým osobám , které se přihlásí přes Identitu občana, podle zákona o právu na digitální služby. Ministr vnitra Vít Rakušan však v pátek oznámil, že automatické vytváření datových schránek bude jako příliš zatěžující zrušeno.
articles.title: Datová schránka se bude i od roku 2023 fyzickým osobám vytvářet jen na žádost

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nedávno vyšla hra Return to Monkey Island a její vývojář Ron Gilbert slíbil brzy linuxovou verzi. V pátek Ron oznámil linuxovou betaverzi. Je potřeba mít hru koupenou na Steamu, jinak se k instrukcím ve fóru Steamu nedostanete.
articles.title: Linuxová betaverze hry Return to Monkey Island je tu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Pine64 představilo malý SBC Ox64 s procesorem RISC-V. Velikostí, naznačením i cenou připomíná Raspberry Pico W, které však má dvoujádrový 32bitový procesor ARM Cortex-M0+ na 133 MHz jen s 264 kB RAM. Ox64 má tři RISC-V jádra, jedno 64bitové (Alibaba T-head C906 480 MHz), jedno 32bitové (Alibaba T-head E907 320 MHz) a jedno s nízkým odběrem. SoC je Bouffalo labs BL808 s 64 MB RAM.
articles.title: Pine64 představilo Ox64 s RISC-V

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Linus Torvalds minulou neděli napsal, že musí jádro zatím spravovat ze svého notebooku, protože v jeho desktopu selhala paměť RAM po 2,5 letech bezproblémového provozu.
articles.title: Linus měl problémy s vadnou pamětí v pracovním počítači

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: SmEjDiL)
articles.description: Druhý říjnový týden proběhla v lotyšské Rize již desátá mezinárodní Zabbix konference pod názvem Zabbix Summit 2022. Konference byla po dvou covidových letech v místě vzniku a byla také přenášena online.
articles.title: Prezentace a zaznamy ze Zabbix Summit 2022

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Jaké jsou postupy organizovaných cyber-crime skupin? Co vše je možné koupit na Darknetu? Jaké informace odtud získat? Jakými prostředky bankomat brání útočníkům, aby se dostal k uloženým penězům? Jde se k těmto penězům dostat bez použití hrubé síly? Lze hacknout auto? Co mobilní telefon? Je pravda, že vás téměř každá tiskárna nenápadně a potají sleduje? Jak kompromitovat uživatelskou stanici? Jak tomu zabránit?
articles.title: Hacking v praxi: prozkoumejte svět počítačové bezpečnosti s etickým hackerem (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Na přelomu září a října se konala LibreOffice konference v Milánu. Konference byla po dvou covidových letech na místě a byla také přenášena online. Nyní se začínají na youtubovém účtu projektu objevovat první videa. Další videa budou postupně přibývat.
articles.title: Videozáznamy z přednášek na LibreOffice konference 2022

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera bylo zveřejněno pět zranitelností linuxového jádra v mac80211. Upravený WiFi paket může způsobit vzdálené spuštění libovolného kódu nebo DoS. Jde o chyby CVE-2022–41674, CVE-2022–42719, CVE-2022–42720, CVE-2022–42721 a CVE-2022–42722.
articles.title: Linuxové jádro má několik závažných zranitelností WiFi - aktualizováno

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Při násobení matic 4×4 nebo 5×5 potřebujeme klasicky 64 nebo 125 násobení (n3). Od roku 1969 existuje Strassenův algoritmus, který snižuje počet násobení na  49 a 98 (~n2,807). Umělá inteligence DeepMind našla ještě rychlejší algoritmus, ve kterém je potřeba jen 47 a 96 násobení.
articles.title: Umělá inteligence našla rychlejší algoritmus násobení matic

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Microsoft Office vyšel v roce 1990. Nyní po 32 letech se název mění na Microsoft 365. Značka Office tedy postupně skončí. Od příštího měsíce se budou přejmenovávat aplikace na Office.com a mobilní aplikace budou přejmenovány v lednu příštího roku.
articles.title: Microsoft Office se bude jmenovat Microsoft 365

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Jihokorejský Hardkernel vydal nové SBC s procesory x86 Odroid-H3 a Odroid-H3+. Jde o náhradu a aktualizaci úspěšného Odroid-H2+, který se již nevyrábí.
articles.title: Odroid H3 a H3+ s procesory Intel Celeron N5105 a Pentium N6005

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na asi největší server Minecraftu Wynncraft mířil rekordní DDoS útok. Útok měl rekordní tok až 2,5 Tb/s, ale hráči si ničeho nevšimli, protože Cloudflare útok úspěšně odfiltroval.
articles.title: Rekordní útok na server Minecraftu 2,5 Tb/s

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera vyšla opravená knihovna zlib 1.2.13, opravuje chybu CVE-2022–37434, která byla objevena letos v srpnu. Zranitelnost spočívá v přetečení zásobníku při použití extra hlavičky. Zranitelné jsou jen aplikace, co používají funkci  inflateGetHeader.
articles.title: Vyšla opravená knihovna zlib 1.2.13

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera vyšla databáze PostgreSQL 15. Mezi novinky patří rychlejší řazení, podle typu dat je výkon větší o 25 – 400 %. Soubory WAL (write-ahead log) je možné nově komprimovat pomocí algoritmů LZ4 a Zstd.
articles.title: Vyšla databáze PostgreSQL 15 s rychlejším řazením a kompresí LZ4 a Zstd

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: VPN umožňuje bezpečně propojit různá zařízení pomocí šifrovaných tunelů. Umožňuje také zapojit uživatele do vnitřní sítě přes zabezpečený přístupový bod. Na našem školení VPN a bezpečné připojení k síti s OpenVPN si prakticky ukážeme, jak to celé nastavit a zprovoznit.
articles.title: Vytvořte si bezpečnou VPN pomocí OpenVPN (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Připravovaný Debian 12 bude mít jméno Bookworm a vyjde v roce 2023. Následovat bude Debian 13 se jménem Trixie, který vyjde v roce 2025. Nyní bylo oznámeno, že následující Debian 14 vydaný v roce 2027 se bude jmenovat Forky. Jméno opět pochází z filmů Příběh hraček (Toy story), tentokrát ze čtvrtého dílu.
articles.title: Debian 14 ponese kódové jméno Forky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Signal oznámil, že odstraní podporu pro odesílání SMS a MMS ze své aplikace pro Android. V zájmu ochrany soukromí, bezpečnosti a přehlednosti začínáme postupně ukončovat podporu SMS v aplikaci pro Android. Budete mít několik měsíců na to, abyste exportovali své zprávy a buď si našli novou aplikaci pro SMS, nebo řekli svým přátelům, aby si stáhli aplikaci Signal, píše se v oznámení.
articles.title: Signal odstraní na Androidu podporu SMS a MMS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Intel chce vyrábět moderní procesory také pro další společnosti, zřejmě také proto vyrobil první 4nm čip s architekturou RISC-V, který je zároveň nejvýkonnějším současným procesorem s touto instrukční sadou. Zatím nemá jméno a používá se pro něj kódový název Intel Horse Creek.
articles.title: Intel vyrábí zatím nejrychlejší procesor RISC-V, umí PCIe 5.0 i DDR5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost 365internet měla dlouhodobě problém plnit své závazky vůči provozovateli infrastruktury, společnosti CETIN. To vyústilo ve vypovězení smlouvy a následnému odpojení zákazníků od původního poskytovatele. Celé situaci se podrobně věnuje Lupa.cz ve svém článku Co bude dál s 365internetem? Hledáme řešení, aby zákazníkům zůstaly původní podmínky, říká jednatel.
articles.title: Přípojky od poskytovatele 365internet převezme společnost WIA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google oficiálně spustil podporu nového bezheslového přihlašovacího standardu Passkey v operačním systému Android a prohlížeči Chrome. Passkey je výrazně bezpečnější náhradou hesel a dalších ověřovacích faktorů, které lze napadnout phishingem. Nelze je použít opakovaně, neuniknou při narušení serveru a chrání uživatele před phishingovými útoky, vysvětlují zástupci Google na blogu.
articles.title: Google spustil bezheslové přihlašování Passkey na Androidu a v Chrome

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Projekt Rustové náhrady standardních GNU Coreutils dosáhl verze 0.0.16. Zásadních novinek moc nečekejme, jde o reimplementaci standardních nástrojů, které jsou v Linuxu zabydlené prakticky od počátku věků a moc nového na nich vymyslet nelze. Výhodou Rustové implementace je to, že vedle rychlejšího běhu oproti GNU Coreutils benefitují i ze zabezpečení paměti a dalších výhod Rustu oproti C.
articles.title: uutils 0.0.16, Rust náhrada GNU Coreutils má přepracovaný tail

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze desktopového prostředí KDE Plasma 5.26, o které už víme, že je předposlední ve své generaci, je na světě. Tvůrci zapracovali na systému widgetů, kdy mnohé dostaly různá visuální vylepšení (lze nově libovolně roztahovat či rotovat), podobné platí i pro TV režim Big Screen a různá rozšíření či plasmoidy. Více upravovat, například zvětšovat, lze i widgety v hlavním panelu (např. kalendář).
articles.title: KDE Plasma 5.26 přináší vylepšení widgety

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Finanční sektor: porostou výdaje na software a hyperkonvergovanou infrastrukturu. Proč by podniky měly kontejnerizovat databáze. Pod 50 tisíc už v Praze v IT téměř nikdo práci nevezme. Navrhli nový způsob bezdrátového nabíjení, bez kolíbky a i pro přístroje v pohybu. Pět klíčových trendů robotické automatizace.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Navrhli nový způsob bezdrátového nabíjení, bez kolíbky a i pro přístroje v pohybu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Poprvé zmapovali galaktické podsvětí z černých děr a neutronových hvězd. Prozkoumali „molekulu“ z atomů a ze světla. Nová Pangea se bude jmenovat Amasia. Přítomnost života na exoplanetách by mohl naznačovat i rajský plyn.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Grafenové tranzistory

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 41/2022

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Ohlížíte se po aktualizaci vašeho operačního systému? Tak přestaňte hledat, protože právě teď už máte skvělé ceny na Windows a Office.
articles.title: Goodoffer24 a Halloween: nabídka doživotní licence na Windows 10 jen za € 12 a na Office za € 23 už je tady!

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled zářijových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za září 2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přibývá aplikací, v nichž je umělá inteligence základem. O deduplikaci s člověkem z praxe. Průvodce výběrem cloudu pro správce dat. Elektronika z jediného izotopu křemíku lépe odvádí teplo. O 6 měsíců později: role kybernetických útoků ve válce na Ukrajině.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Elektronika z jediného izotopu křemíku lépe odvádí teplo

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 40/2022

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Bayesovská statistika a život na exoplanetách. Molekulární kvantové počítače. Skleněná porézní plastelína. Záhadné vlnění v Mléčné dráze.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Nejdelší dobrý molekulární vodič má 2,6 nanometru

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Tuzemské organizace potřebují posílit ochranu dat. Herní specialista s pracovním přesahem – monitor Dell G322Q. Canyon Accessories: úplná kontrola kvality ve vlastních rukou. Taktik přibírá nástroj pro simulaci útoků. IBM posiluje bezpečnost a AI s mainframem Z16 Telum. VMware pomáhá zákazníkům orientovat se v multicloudovém světě. Pražský Karlín jako kalifornské Mountain View?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Tuzemské organizace potřebují posílit ochranu dat

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Rakety na antihmotu. Voda jako 2D materiál. Jezer na Marsu mohlo být víc. Saturnovy prstence mohou být pozůstatkem měsíce Chrysalis. Lonsdaleit, zvláštní diamant kombinovaný s grafenem. Jak se učí průmysloví roboti.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Rekordně urychlené elektrony

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Zdaleka ne každý může utratit stovky dolarů za softwarové upgrady. To je také důvod, proč Goodoffer24 staví Microsoft na vedlejší kolej snížením ceny za Windows 10 a Microsoft Office, čímž činí proces aktualizace mnohem dostupnějším. Dokonce můžete koupit obojí naráz, a tím ušetříte ještě více. A tady je, co můžete dostat.
articles.title: Goodoffer24 – dobré zprávy: doživotní licence na Windows 10 jen za 12 €, Office za 24 € právě dorazil!

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán Mozilla Firefox 106.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání a na stránce věnované vývojářům. Zdůraznit lze lepší podporu WebRTC. Řešeny jsou rovněž bezpečnostní chyby. Nový Firefox 106 bude brzy k dispozici také na Flathubu a Snapcraftu.
articles.title: Firefox 106.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: GitHub Copilot investigation. Právníci řeší, zda jít do soudního sporu proti GitHubu a jeho GitHub Copi­lotu kvůli porušování autorských práv vývojářů open source softwaru.
articles.title: GitHub Copilot investigation

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Zítra a pozítří probíhá online Espressif Developer Conference 2022. Jedná se o první oficiální vývojářskou konferenci Espressifu, společnosti stojící za rodinou SoC ESP32.
articles.title: Espressif Developer Conference 2022

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová opravná vydání 22.03.2 (Changelog) a 21.02.5 (Changelog) linuxové distribuce primárně určené pro routery a vestavěné systémy OpenWrt (Wikipedie). Řešeny jsou bezpečnostní chyby v Linuxu / Wi-Fi.
articles.title: OpenWrt 22.03.2 a 21.02.5

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Codeberg nabízí zdarma hosting open source projektů. Stojí za ním stejnojmenná neziskovka se sídlem v Berlíně. Postaven je na Gitea.  Statické webové stránky lze publikovat na Codeberg Pages.
articles.title: Codeberg a Codeberg Pages

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Rada Evropské unie se dohodla na posílení bezpečnosti dodavatelských řetězců IKT: V reakci na některé z dosud nejzávažnějších kybernetických útoků a řadu hrozeb, jimž jsou dodavatelské řetězce informačních a komunikačních technologií (IKT) vystaveny, schválily členské státy závěry Rady, jež přispějí k větší bezpečnosti aktiv EU v oblasti IKT. Tato naléhavá výzva k přijetí opatření byla motivována současnou geopolitickou situací, škodlivou povahou útoků na dodavatelské řetězce a stále rostoucí závislostí naší společnosti na digitálních technologiích. Výzva se zaměřuje na posílení bezpečnosti dodavatelského řetězce IKT a je rovněž prvním krokem k řešení hrozeb nežádoucí strategické závislosti v rámci dodavatelských řetězců IKT.
articles.title: Rada Evropské unie se dohodla na posílení bezpečnosti dodavatelských řetězců IKT

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V Austinu začala konference O3DCon. Při té příležitosti byl Open 3D Engine (O3DE), tj. open source 3D herní a simulační engine, vydán v nové verzi 22.10.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: Open 3D Engine (O3DE) 22.10.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Bjorn Stahl představil nový shell Lash#Cat9 pro svůj display server, multimediální framework a herní engine Arcan. Ukázka možností na YouTube. Zdrojové kódy na GitHubu.
articles.title: Arcan: nový shell Lash#Cat9

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 5.5 živé linuxové distribuce Tails (The Amnesic Incognito Live System), jež klade důraz na ochranu soukromí uživatelů a anonymitu. Přehled změn v příslušném seznamu. Bezpečnostní chyby v Linuxu / Wi-Fi zatím nebyly opraveny.
articles.title: Tails 5.5

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: warpd umožňuje ovládat ukazatel myši pomocí klávesnice. Další podobný software v diskusi na Hacker News.
articles.title: warpd, ovládání ukazatele myši pomocí klávesnice

articles.description: As some interesting open-source news out of Microsoft today, their open-source Windows Termina that has been in development the past few years and providing many modern features is now the default beginning with Windows 11 22H2...
articles.title: Microsoft Promotes Its Open-Source Terminal To The Default For Windows 11 CLI Apps

articles.description: MoltenVK as the portability layer for Vulkan that exposes this industry standard graphics API on Apple's macOS, iOS, and tvOS platforms is now able to expose Vulkan 1.2 compatibility...
articles.title: MoltenVK Updated For Vulkan 1.2 Support On Apple macOS/iOS

articles.description: Git 2.38.1 was just released along with updates to older versions, including the new point releases of v2.30.6, v2.31.5, v2.32.4, v2.33.5, v2.34.5, v2.35.5, v2.36.3, and v2.37.4. The big set of Git updates today is due to two more security issues coming to light...
articles.title: Git 2.38.1 Released For Two New Security Vulnerabilities

articles.description: AMD, Google, Microsoft, and NVIDIA have used this week's OCP Global Summit to announce Caliptra as their open specification for a silicon Root-of-Trust (ROT) to be found with future CPUs / SoCs, GPUs, NICs, SSDs, and other hardware components.
articles.title: AMD, Google, Microsoft & NVIDIA Announce "Caliptra" Open-Source Root of Trust

articles.description: Last year the OpenPOWER Foundation announced LibreBMC as a POWER-based open-source BMC and now they have progressed to the point of actually demoing this BMC backed by a fully open-source software stack...
articles.title: OpenPOWER Foundation Demoes The LibreBMC POWER-Based Open-Source BMC

articles.description: Coreboot 4.18 had been planned for release in August but after that slipped, this newest Coreboot feature release is now shipping and comes with many hardware support improvements and other changes for this open-source system firmware implementation...
articles.title: Coreboot 4.18 Released With AMD Morgana & Intel Meteor Lake SoC Support

articles.description: Back in August I wrote about a patch to change AMD's CPU microcode loading on Linux to now patch every logical CPU thread rather than just per physical core. It turned out that at least some CPU microcode updates do make per-thread modifications while the Linux kernel microcode handling for AMD was just applying microcode updates at run-time on a per-core basis. That patch was seemingly forgotten about but has now been queued up as part of x86 "urgent" changes for the mainline kernel...
articles.title: AMD CPU Microcode Fix For Linux To Patch Every Logical Thread Nears Mainline

articles.description: Microsoft has released its monthly update to CBL-Mariner 2.0, its in-house Linux distribution serving a variety of purposes from WSL to Azure...
articles.title: Microsoft Releases Its Linux Distribution Update For October 2022

articles.description: Two weeks ago a bunch of old Mesa code got removed including the XvMC front-end, Rbug as a remote debugging interface, and some of Graw that was to serve as a raw Gallium3D interface without a traditional Gallium front-end. Some of Graw was accidentally left in the source tree while now that has been caught and eliminated in further lightening the size of Mesa...
articles.title: Mesa's Gallium3D Finishes Gutting Out Its Graw Interface

articles.description: Valve is preparing to roll-out Proton 7.0-5 as the newest version of this Wine-derived software that powers Steam Play for enjoying Windows games on Linux. For facilitating some testing prior to the formal Proton 7.0-5, a release candidate was published today...
articles.title: Proton 7.0-5 RC Gets More Windows Games Running On Linux

articles.description: Libcamera has been in development for several years now as an open-source camera support library that works across Linux, Android, and Chrome OS platforms. Due to interest from seeing tagged releases, the libcamera crew has published their first official release of this open-source camera stack...
articles.title: libcamera Celebrates Its First Release As Camera Support Library For Linux

articles.description: Ahead of O3DCON kicking off tomorrow in Austin, Texas as a developer event around the Open 3D Engine game engine backed by the Linux Foundation and numerous organizations, O3DE 22.10 has been released...
articles.title: Open 3D Engine 22.10 Released With Better Multiplayer Support, Usability Improvements

articles.description: VESA today announced the publishing of the DisplayPort 2.1 specification. As a pleasant change, VESA has been working behind the scenes to see that all DisplayPort 2.0 certified products are actually forward-compatible with this more strict DisplayPort 2.1 specification...
articles.title: DisplayPort 2.1 Spec Published - All DP 2.0 Devices Compatible

articles.description: Now that Linux 6.1-rc1 was released, here is my look at all of the interesting kernel changes and new features that landed over the past two weeks. Linux 6.1 is shaping up to be another exciting kernel with many new software features, new hardware enablement work, and other changes for this end-of-year 2022 kernel version that is also likely to be the next Linux LTS release.
articles.title: Linux 6.1 Features Include Initial Rust Code, MGLRU, New AMD CPU Features, More Security

articles.description: Firefox 106.0 web browser release builds are now available ahead of the official Firefox 106 announcement on Tuesday. Firefox 106 does have improvements to its PDF viewer as well as the WebRTC communication support...
articles.title: Firefox 106 Brings Improved WebRTC - Better Screen Sharing On Wayland

articles.description: Prominent KDE developer Nate Graham who the past several years has focused on fixing many bugs and nuisances with the KDE desktop as well as being well known for his weekly "This Week In KDE" development summaries has been elected to the KDE e.V. Board of Directors. As part of the board, his platform is on fundraising more for KDE and hoping to hire more developers to further accelerate this open-source desktop environment...
articles.title: Prominent KDE Developer Nate Graham Joins The KDE e.V. Board - Pitches More Fundraising

articles.description: After Intel posted a set of patches last week for the GNU Compiler Collection around Raptor Lake, Meteor Lake, and Sierra Forest, the two more basic patches have already been merged into the GCC 13 code-base while the Sierra Forest Xeon E-core patches and the various new instructions presented there are still undergoing review...
articles.title: Intel Meteor Lake "-march=meteorlake" Support Lands In GCC 13

articles.description: The Arcan project that started out as a display server built atop a game engine and with time has introduced many features and experimenting with original approaches to longstanding Linux desktop/display shortcomings, has announced their Cat9 shell. This modern terminal has been in development for nearly six years while now the developers are finally confident in announcing this initiative...
articles.title: Arcan Project Announces The Modern & Radically Different Cat9 Shell

articles.description: This should hardly come as a surprise given Fedora's tendency to ship with bleeding-edge package versions, but Fedora Linux 38 next spring will offer PHP 8.2 for those wanting to run a LAMP stack on this modern, Red Hat sponsored Linux distribution...
articles.title: PHP 8.2 Cleared For Introduction In Fedora 38

articles.description: Linus Torvalds just issued the first release candidate of Linux 6.1 and in turn marking the end of the merge window for this feature-packaged kernel release. Linux 6.1 stable in turn should be out in December and will likely serve as this year's Linux LTS kernel release...
articles.title: Linux 6.1-rc1 Released With Rust Now In The Kernel, MGLRU Added, New Hardware Support

articles.description: Following last month's introduction of the Ryzen 7000 series "Zen 4" processors, AMD has finally posted the code providing initial enablement for the Zen 4 CPUs with the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC)...
articles.title: AMD Sends Out Basic Zen 4 "Znver4" Enablement For The GCC Compiler

articles.description: Google this week has announced the release of KataOS as their newest operating system effort focused on embedded devices running ambient machine learning workloads. KataOS is security-minded, exclusively uses the Rust programming language, and is built atop the seL4 microkernel as its foundation...
articles.title: Google Announces KataOS As Security-Focused OS, Leveraging Rust & seL4 Microkernel

articles.description: The IBM POWER/PowerPC changes were merged this week for the Linux 6.1 kernel with this cycle's merge window closing later today...
articles.title: Linux 6.1 POWERs Up With KFENCE, Syscall Wrappers, Execute-Only Memory

articles.description: For the Linux 6.1 kernel Btrfs is bringing some significant performance optimizations and with EXT4 there is also some performance tuning. But when it comes to the Flash-Friendly File-System (F2FS) and the XFS file-systems this cycle is on the lighter side...
articles.title: XFS & F2FS Changes Are Tame For Linux 6.1

articles.description: The Xen hypervisor changes were merged this week for the Linux 6.1 kernel merge window that is wrapping up this weekend...
articles.title: Linux 6.1 Xen Supports Grant-Based VirtIO For x86_64

articles.description: While there has been more open-source digital audio workstation (DAW) software solutions in recent years, Ardour that has been in development since 2005 remains one of the best professional-grade and cross-platform digital audio workstation solutions. It's now even better with today's big Ardour 7.0 release...
articles.title: Ardour 7.0 Digital Audio Workstation Released

articles.description: HP's commercial/business-focused laptops expose a Windows WMI interface that supports the web-based enterprise management of the BIOS configurations. The "HP-BIOSCFG" Linux driver is now being worked on to allow managing the BIOS settings for these HP laptops from within Linux...
articles.title: HP-BIOSCFG Driver Being Worked On For HP Laptop BIOS Management Under Linux

articles.description: The VirtIO changes were merged this week for the Linux 6.1 merge window that is ending this weekend...
articles.title: Linux 6.1 Brings VirtIO Block "Secure Erase", vDPA Feature Provisioning

articles.description: A set of 12 patches adding 720 lines of new code and removing 222 lines of existing code to Intel's "ANV" open-source Vulkan driver have been merged for Mesa 22.3 to help reduce the Vulkan push descriptor CPU overhead...
articles.title: Intel's Vulkan Driver Lands More Patches To Help Reduce CPU Overhead

articles.description: Among the pull requests coming in late in the merge window for the Linux 6.1 cycle is the "sched/psi" updates for the code improvements around Pressure Stall Information...
articles.title: Linux 6.1 Picks Up Some Improvements For Pressure Stall Information (PSI)

articles.description: Last month Intel published the XeSS 1.0 SDK for their Xe Super Sampling technology showcased with Arc Graphics discrete graphics cards. Sadly their initial SDK drop included Windows binaries and wasn't fully open-source. On Friday XeSS 1.0.1 was published with some bug fixes but still not being fully open-source...
articles.title: Intel XeSS 1.0.1 Released With Bug Fixes

articles.description: The KDE Plasma Wayland session is finally supporting high resolution scroll wheel support that was engineered by Red Hat and originally supported under GNOME for allowing a smoother scrolling experience on the Linux desktop...
articles.title: KDE Plasma Wayland Now Supports High Resolution Scrolling

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Look good while looking at the lights
When you next get involved in a street fight — as we all do — you might want to ensure that you're dressed for success, (or at least to impress), by donning one of these full-print Street Fighter bomber jackets, now available to order from merchandiser NERDS Clothing.
Officially produced in collaboration with Capcom, the powerfully colored jackets are styled after several members of the Street Fighter roster, with variants for legendary World Warriors Ryu, Chun-Li, Bison, Cammy, and new boy Luke. Each jacket features a color scheme typified by the character, with a full backprint showcasing the fighter in action. Somewhat anachronistically, the jackets are also emblazoned with an embroidered Street Fighter V logo, right on the cusp of Street Fighter 6's vaunted release.
https://twitter.com/NERDSClothingCo/status/1582068026777563136?s=20&t=BuudnLBe7wEwNUhezKmeLw
I'm obviously a dedicated and dyed-in-the-wool Street Fighter disciple, but it's not in my build or age range to rock one of these bad boys.  Perhaps, however, they are more in keeping with your own sense of style and fashion.  If so, then you can check out the entire range over on the official NERDS Clothing website, where the jackets are available to order for $125 USD each (not including shipping costs).
(Edit: Since this article was published, all jackets — along with a range of new shirts — have suddenly been listed as being "sold out".  This is a little curious, given that they haven't even been available for a day, and the entire stock, in all eight sizes, has seemingly cleared out. I have reached out to the company for clarity.)
Street Fighter V is available now on PlayStation and PC. Street Fighter 6 will launch in 2023 on PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms.
The post Official Street Fighter bomber jackets will see you get beat up in style appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Official Street Fighter bomber jackets will see you get beat up in style

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
More fun merch from Fangamer
Not content with offering some super cool merchandise from indie smash Hades, Fangamer has lifted the lid on its latest collection of physical goodies, which are all based upon Finji's awesome fantasy adventure game, Tunic.
Tunic fans can visit the Fangamer store today to pick up this very cheerful shirt, emblazoned with new artwork of our foxy hero and their myriad enemies.  Designed by artist Jorge M. Velez, the new shirt comes in women's and unisex styles, and features a suitable "leafy-green" color palette. Additionally, a trio of additional clothing items — including another T-shirt, a hooded sweatshirt, and a zip-up jacket — are all currently in the works, and will form a line known as the "Sacred Geometry" collection.

In collaboration with Stumpy Frog a…
articles.title: Feeling Foxy? Be sure to bag yourself this adorable Tunic plush toy

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Little Goody Two-Shoes himself
It's sure been a busy gaming year for Evil Dead's premier deadite slayer Ash Williams, not only has the chainsaw-bedecked smart-ass received his own brand new video game, but he is now joining the star-studded roster of Epic Games' juggernaut battle royale release, Fortnite.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-23660L8hAY
Ash, boomstick and all, is one of several additions to Fortnite's annual Halloween event — the amusingly titled "Fortnitemares".  This celebration of everything spooky and ooky kicks off across all platforms today, bringing with it themed maps, modes, characters, and weapons.  There will be a selection of free seasonal cosmetics dolled out to all players who partake in the event, with Ash Williams, Rick & Morty character Queen Summer, and the Me…
articles.title: Evil Dead’s Ash Williams joins Fortnite Halloween festivities

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Pick your path through a subterranean venture
Final Fantasy XIV received patch 6.25 today, which adds a surprising amount of content to dig into on the MMO's peripheries.
The variant and criterion dungeons make their debut in patch 6.25. These activities offer both new challenges and rewards for players, as well as a deeper dive into the lore behind one of Final Fantasy XIV's starting areas, Ul'dah.
Variants and criteria
You can start the quest chain in Old Sharlayan, by starting the Keys to the Past line by the docks. I won't go into too much detail on where it goes from there, but longtime players will likely be pleased to see a certain character take the focus on this adventure.
The actual variant dungeon itself is a forking encounter, which you can complete with anywhere from one to fo…
articles.title: Final Fantasy XIV adds special dungeons and more Hildibrand with patch 6.25

articles.author: CJ Andriessen
articles.description:
Snap into a slim Jimmy-6
I recently went on a little book-buying bonanza, readying my little library for the cold autumn and winter nights that’ll soon be coming to my wee corner of the world. Most of my purchases were novels designed to make me look intelligent and well-informed when guests see them on my shelves. But one was a pure nostalgia purchase. Earlier this year, Abrams Books released a compendium of The Uncanny X-Men trading cards that were illustrated by Jim Lee. These cards were a massive part of my childhood. I used to have an incredibly thick binder that had hundreds of these cards in it, and every once in a while, I would thumb through its pages, gawking at my collection.
While sentimental, the book’s decision to limit one side of one card per page makes it a rather annoying…
articles.title: Early Access Review: Marvel Snap

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
More monsters and mazes coming October 26
Square Enix has released a slew of exciting new details pertaining to the upcoming DLC for Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin — The "Wanderer of The Rift" expansion will bring with it new dungeons to explore, new tools to master, and, the lord of chaos themselves, the fearsome warrior Gilgamesh.
Arriving October 26, The Wanderer of The Rift DLC will see the gargantuan and proud fighter introduce themselves to our team of heroes, bedecked in glorious kabuki battle armor and most certainly up for the rumble.  Gilgamesh is equipped with a variety of devastating weaponry — including spears, swords, and axes — and, as one who has harnessed space and time, will make for an unpredictable and challenging opponent.  As to their intentions in the wor…
articles.title: Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin DLC introduces the mighty Gilgamesh

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Celebrate the scary season
Xbox is lining up its later Game Pass additions for October, and it's an interesting mix. There are some scares, some mysteries, and one big RPG that can easily take your time.
Persona 5 Royal is one of the big additions for this month on Xbox Game Pass. It hits cloud, console, and PC on October 21, bringing the previously PlayStation-exclusive RPG to new platforms.
Worth noting that Royal also hits PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch, as well as Steam, on October 21.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MDSXGIigC3Q
If you're looking for frights though, might I suggest the Amnesia games and, especially, Soma? All arrive on Game Pass this month, and SOMA is one story I don't think I'll be able to dislodge from my head anytime soon.
While the Amnesia series focuses on a l…
articles.title: Xbox Game Pass gets Persona, frights, and a frog in October

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
I feel so funky
I’ve been a massive fan of Ghostbusters for almost as long as I can remember. That means I’m insufferably picky. I haven’t even watched the 2016 reboot or Ghostbusters: Afterlife. It’s already been proven you can’t top the majesty of the original film. Video games are similar. Most games made off the license are okay at best and abysmal at worst.
When Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed was announced, I was skeptical. I’m not typically drawn to multi-player-focused games, and anyone who touches my beloved had better have immaculate hands. This time, it’s Illfonic, makers of the Friday the 13th game. They’ve proven themselves before, even if it was sort of overshadowed by Dead by Daylight. So, as I fastened up my positron collider, I kept a stance of cautiously optimistic mixed …
articles.title: Review: Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
It better make my coffee too
Sony Interactive Entertainment has finally released details on its upcoming pro controller DualSense Edge — The top-tier tech will launch for the PlayStation 5 platform in January 2023, priced at $199.99 USD.  Pre-orders will open exclusively on the PlayStation Direct store from October 25.
The DualSense Edge Wireless Controller is set to be Sony's premier controller for the PlayStation enthusiast. The new pad features a wide variety of customizable components and redefinable functions, ranging from trigger stop guards and replaceable thumbstick modules to programmable buttons, and save states for custom game layouts, alongside adjustable "dead zones" and trigger pressure.
You can check out the DualSense Edge's features in the trailer below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UvmmWeov68s
Alongside its swappable thumb grips, modules, and triggers, the DualSense Edge will also feature a tough, braided USB cord complete with lock, to prevent those accidental disconnects.  The controller sports advanced Haptic Feedback technology as well as built-in audio controls for headphones and the onboard speaker.  In addition, the Edge's sleek carry case will also double as a charging dock (though it must remain wired in order to charge the controller.  It is not a battery backup device.)
The Sony DualSense Edge Wireless Controller will launch January 2023 at a retail price of $199.99 USD, which equates to a staggering £209.99 GBP or €239.99 EUR, half the price of the PS5 digital console itself. However, for those who take their control methods very, very seriously and their wallet very, very lightly, this affluent technology will be the most mechanically precise Sony gamepad available.
Pre-orders for the DualSense Edge Wireless Controller go live October 25 exclusively on PlayStation Direct.
The post DualSense Edge PS5 controller launches January 2023, priced at $199 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: DualSense Edge PS5 controller launches January 2023, priced at $199

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Hey, it's that dawg...
Capcom has announced that it will be hosting a brand new Resident Evil Showcase presentation later this week, complete with new trailers, updates, and details regarding its upcoming releases as they pertain to the iconic survival horror franchise.
Specifically, the broadcast will feature new footage and news surrounding both the upcoming Resident Evil Village: Gold Edition, the Winters Expansion DLC, and the highly anticipated remake of franchise favorite Resident Evil 4.  So anybody with a knack for battling either giant vampiric countesses or diminutive Napoleonic cult leaders will most certainly want to tune in and get up to speed on the ghoulish goings-on. With only 10 days to go until Gold Edition's launch, it's a fine time for it.
https://youtu.be/3Ss4_4bZhQI
The Resident Evil Showcase will take place Thursday, October 20 at 15:00 PT / 18:00 ET / 23:00 BST and can be viewed on the official Capcom/Resident Evil YouTube and Twitch channels, as well as their respective social media platforms.  While the length of the broadcast was not revealed, Capcom rarely tends to stray beyond the 30-minute mark for their presentations. God forbid everybody tried that.
Resident Evil Village: Gold Edition launches October 28 on PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms.
The post Resident Evil Showcase stream set for Thursday, October 20 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Resident Evil Showcase stream set for Thursday, October 20

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Xbox department among those affected
According to a report from Business Insider, Microsoft has made major layoffs across its entire company, with many "hundreds" of employees from many different departments finding themselves out of work.
Several teams within Microsoft have been hit with major cuts, with some divisions and subsidiaries — such as war sim developer Studio Alpha — forced to close entirely.  The cuts have reportedly affected a wide variety of in-house departments, from Microsoft's space technology division to its premier gaming platform, Xbox.  While the exact number of layoffs is unknown, Business Insider suggests it is in the region of hundreds but is overall less than 1000.
"Like all companies, we evaluate our business priorities on a regular basis, and make structural adjustments accordingly," a Microsoft spokesperson in comments to Eurogamer. "We will continue to invest in our business and hire in key growth areas in the year ahead."
As all global industries adjust to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, slowed production, reduced consumer spending, and a steadily increasing cost of living crisis, even some of the world's biggest and most successful companies seem to be tightening purse strings at best, and making sweeping staff cuts at worst.  As always, it is the "little people" that feel the hardest impact, forced out of work at a time of complete economic uncertainty, in a working world for which fragility has become a universal concern.
The post Microsoft reportedly lays off hundreds of employees from its work force appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Microsoft reportedly lays off hundreds of employees from its work force

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
It will steal your heart! Unless...
I like upgrades. I like definitive editions. When something I already enjoy looks better than it did the last time I played it? I like that. While the current generation edition of Persona 5 Royal is a boon for anyone who never owned a PlayStation 4, it's hard to even refer to it as an upgrade for people who did.
If you already dug into the details of this new version, you might be wondering why we’re here. Why couldn’t this be a PS5 upgrade patch? Having spent some time with this new version and done my duty of squinting at finer details, I can tell you definitively: I have no idea.

The sales pitch
I chose to look at the PlayStation 5 version since I could easily just pop in the PlayStation 4 version to scrutinize for differences. Would people on PC an…
articles.title: Persona 5 Royal is pretty poor value for PlayStation players

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Unsure if the servers can also escape capitalism by going into space
Several EA games are due to have their servers shut down in the coming weeks.
As spotted by TrueAchievements, several Electronic Arts games are currently on track to have their servers shut down. Mirror's Edge, NBA Jam: On Fire Edition, Gatling Gears, and Shank 2 are all due to close servers at the start of the new year. The games were recently added to the EA site tracking servers due for updates or closure.
As detailed on EA's site for service updates, games may still be playable offline.
TrueAchievements notes that two achievements in one of the affected games, NBA Jam: On Fire Edition, do require online play. So you may want to get working on those now if you still want to pick them up. Others, like Mirror's Edge, aren't really affected by the closure.
Though if you're looking to play some online Command & Conquer, be aware that Red Alert 3 and C&C3 servers are also due to close in November. They may go down, but Tim Curry's performance in RA3 will live on forever.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g1Sq1Nr58hM
EA's site also details service updates, too. A prime example is The Sims 4, which is shifting over to a free-to-play version on October 18.
Here's the full list of upcoming closures and when they're happening.
October 20, 2022
Army of Two: The 40th Day
Army of Two: The Devil's Cartel
Dragon Age: Origins (MP Screenshots Server)
November 9, 2022
Command & Conquer: Red Alert 3
Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars
Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath
Mercenaries 2: World in Flames (PS3, 360)
November 30, 2022
Onrush
January 19, 2023
Mirror's Edge
NBA Jam: On Fire Edition
Gatling Gears
Shank 2
The post Mirror’s Edge and other EA games are closing servers down appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Mirror’s Edge and other EA games are closing servers down

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The 1.2.1 update introduced a new issue and Nintendo is looking into it
[Update: Nintendo has outlined its plans for a fix this week, rolling out two updates detailed on its site, as spotted by VGC. The Google translation of the text says one version will roll out on October 18, restoring online play, with a second to follow on the 20th.
Our original story on the outage from October 14 follows.]
Nintendo has taken the servers for Switch Sports down, suspending online play and save data backup while it investigates a new issues causing crashes.
As shared across the different Nintendo social accounts, a bug has been found in the latest Ver. 1.2.1 update of Nintendo Switch Sports. It's been causing crashes during the pre-match loading screen, affecting both online and offline play.
While Nint…
articles.title: Switch Sports servers are coming back online [Update]

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
Bayonetta's new voice actress speaks out
In case you missed it, there's been a whole lot of controversy this week surrounding the upcoming release of Bayonetta 3 this week.  The original Bayonetta voice actress, Hellena Taylor, who has voiced Cereza in both of the mainline games and the spin-offs, took to Twitter this week to ask players to boycott the series' third entry.  While the game's director, Yusuke Miyata, stated that "various overlapping circumstances made it difficult for Hellena Taylor to reprise her role," Taylor says that she turned down the role because she was offered a mere $4,000 in payment for her potential voice work on Bayonetta 3, which is negligible compared to the value she has brought to the series.  Instead, prolific voice actress Jennifer Hale, known for roles li…
articles.title: Jennifer Hale responds to the Bayonetta voice acting controversy

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Lemme tell you something
I often opine that video games have not been very good to Ghostbusters. I would think that the entrepreneurial attitude of the original movie depicting a very chaotic and game-like profession would be ripe for translation, but most titles that approach the subject matter fumble it. Sometimes they fumble it catastrophically. Ghostbusters on the NES is among the worst games I’ve ever played.
The go-to answer for a Ghostbusters game done right is Ghostbusters: The Video Game, and it’s absolutely a decent effort. However, despite getting together the original cast and sticking pretty faithfully to the license, the narrative felt tonally off, and the gameplay was merely middling.
If you want the game that really deserves to be considered the best title wearing the tan f…
articles.title: New Ghostbusters II on NES will make you feel good

articles.author: Noelle Warner
articles.description:
The apocalypse never looked so stylish
If I know anything about gamers, it's that we love to show our love of gaming to others, and what better way to do that than to wear your favorite game right on your clothing?  If you happen to love Horizon: Forbidden West in particular, you're really in luck, because Guerrilla has teamed up with ASOS to create a brand new line of loungewear inspired by the game.  The various shirts, hoodies, and pants all feature bright prints with various iconography from Forbidden West, and they're the perfect statement piece for the fashionable gamers out there.
There are five different looks in total, including an all-over printed hoodie and jogger set, a long-sleeved mesh top, an over-sized printed t-shirt, a crewneck hoodie, and a brown co-ord hoodie and jogger set.  All of the pieces are unisex, which means anybody can achieve the cool, oversized loungewear look.  My personal favorite is the crewneck hoodie, which features comic panels inspired by Horizon: Forbidden West.  The all-over prints are a bit busy for my taste, but I would for sure get cozy in that brown set any day of the week.

The pieces range from £26 for the shirts to £76 for the co-ord set, but overall I'd say that's pretty affordable for this kind of product. I guess it is ASOS, after all.  Unfortunately, the Horizon x ASOS collab is only available to those in the EU, UK, Japan, and Asia regions, but for everyone else, I would put money down on people listing these on eBay (for a higher price, but still).  At the very least, it's nice to look, and we can hope that they'll ship to the US in the future.
You know what awesome gaming clothing store does ship out here, though?  Insert Coin Clothing.  They've been a staple for gaming clothing for years, and their stuff is always amazing quality.
The post Guerrilla teamed up with ASOS for a Horizon: Forbidden West loungewear collection appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Guerrilla teamed up with ASOS for a Horizon: Forbidden West loungewear collection

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The lead is leaving after over 11 years at the company
The director behind the upcoming Splinter Cell remake is leaving Ubisoft.
David Grivel announced his departure on LinkedIn, as spotted by VGC. Grivel started out at Ubisoft Paris working on Ghost Recon: Future Soldier before moving to Toronto's office. There, he worked on games including Splinter Cell Blacklist, the Far Cry series, and eventually the remake of Splinter Cell.
"After more than 11 years at Ubisoft, it is now time for me to go on a new adventure," Grivel wrote on his LinkedIn page. "11 years is a long time and summing it up in one post is quasi-impossible but I must say, I’ve been lucky. Lucky to work with so many great people over the years. Made so many friends."
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HH1_ZCSf_HY
While he's leaving the studio, it sounds like Grivel is not leaving the games industry. The now-former director says to "stay tuned" for what is next for him.
Chaos theory
With its director departing, it'll be interesting to see what Ubisoft is up to with the new take on Splinter Cell. The company has reportedly seen above-average turnover, some of which has been attributed to the reported-on studio culture at Ubisoft.
The Splinter Cell remake has quietly been in development at Ubisoft Toronto. Though we've only seen confirmation and a short teaser for it, we've heard a few details.
This includes that the new take on Sam Fisher's story won't be open world. And it will re-tackle the story for a "modern-day audience" as well. No release date has been set for the project.
The post Splinter Cell Remake director is leaving Ubisoft appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Splinter Cell Remake director is leaving Ubisoft

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Of Rats and Resilience
Asked about "horror games", a genre that has come into its own over the past two decades, many players will distinctly think of the visceral, the grotesque, and the physically unfathomable.  These terrors can arrive in the form of mushroom-headed mutants, giant, overhead spiders, or hideous, skinless, black-eyed zombies, ready to pop up directly into your PoV with a ghastly scream in what we have coined the "jump scare".
Boo.
But, even within scenarios set outside of our own sphere of time or reality, horror can strike much closer to home.  It can be presented in its purest form, via themes of grief, regret, responsibility, and, scariest of all, the loss of one's own capabilities, focus, and mind.  I've never encountered a mushroom-headed mutant, but I've been comple…
articles.title: Review: A Plague Tale: Requiem

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Rapid-fire Robots
Japanese studio Aniplex has released a lightning-fast teaser trailer for its upcoming anime NieR: Automata Ver1.1a, an animated series set within PlatinumGames/Square Enix dystopian sci-fi universe.
Titled "Promotion File 003: Bunker", the brief preview introduces us to the incredibly stern and authoritative voice of Commander White, portrayed by veteran voice actor Chiaki Kanou.  Barking out commands while threateningly tapping a crop of some kind, Commander White is seemingly in charge of a battalion of YoRHa-esque battle bots, who will no doubt be charged with taking the fight to the army of metal monstrosities — The Machines — currently laying siege to planet Earth.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9p26isMDvuM
In addition to the blink-and-you'll-miss-it clip, Aniplex released a promotional image, depicting Commander White alongside several members of their regiment. It looks like we're going to have to wait a little longer for full details on the anime's narrative and cast, but it's clear that NieR: Automata Ver1.1a is more of an adaptation of the NieR universe and its interplanetary warfare in general, rather than a direct retelling of the events depicted in Platinum's smash-selling video game series.
NieR: Automata Ver1.1a will premiere in Japan in early 2023.  NieR: Automata is available now on PlayStation, PC, and Xbox platforms. A long-awaited Nintendo Switch port, known as "The End of YoRHa Edition" was released worldwide on October 6.  You can check out Jonathan Holmes thoughts on the release right here.
The post Don’t blink during this teaser trailer for the NieR: Automata Ver1.1a anime appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Don’t blink during this teaser trailer for the NieR: Automata Ver1.1a anime

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
Mario, Rabbids, and tactics mix well once again
The first Mario + Rabbids crossover was an interesting, surprising mix of ideas that you wouldn't presume would work together. But while Kingdom Battle laid out the groundwork, Mario + Rabbids Sparks of Hope feels like it's expanding the ideas and making something a bit more its own. And it's all the better for it.
It doesn't take long to get into the actual battles in Sparks of Hope. While the crew is lounging about at Peach's Castle, they're suddenly thrust into an interstellar conflict. The evil Cursa is vying for control of the galaxy. Meanwhile, Lumas are being turned Rabbid, making them into Sparks that need Mario and crew's help.
Mario, Luigi, and Peach all rejoin the starting roster, alongside their Rabbid counterparts. Down the line,…
articles.title: Review in Progress: Mario + Rabbids Sparks of Hope

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
It better have a 'Sonic Sez' segment
We are only a few short weeks away from the return of an icon, as Sonic Frontiers prepares for its November debut on PlayStation, PC, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch platforms — And while fans wait for The Blue Blur to return, Sega hopes to perform some important scene-setting via a narrative prologue, to be delivered in both comic-book and animation form.
https://twitter.com/sonic_hedgehog/status/1580921453058269184?s=20&t=zeTgb9VfOmVDW23JNKjcnQ
As revealed on the official Sonic the Hedgehog Twitter, Sega is preparing to drop a two-part digital comic, that will offer up a little backstory on the events that preceded Sonic finding himself isolated in a strange, eerie, and monolithic new world.  Sonic the Hedgehog: Convergence is written by frequent Sonic scribe Ian Flynn — with characterful artwork by Evan Stanley & Heather Breckel — and will no doubt provide suitable reading to get series' fans hype fires burning brightly before the game's big launch.
While no further information was offered, Sega did announce that an animated short is also in the works, which will again help lay the groundwork for the new adventure.  Sega has utilized animation frequently in its marketing of Sonic the Hedgehog titles.  And usually to very good effect, as the world of Sonic and his anthro pals always lends itself very well to the medium of animation — perhaps better than any other gaming franchise.  We'll be sure to give you a heads-up when the Sonic Frontiers comic and animated short are available.
Sonic Frontiers launches November 8 on PlayStation, PC, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch platforms.
The post Sonic Frontiers to set the scene with prologue cartoon and comic appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sonic Frontiers to set the scene with prologue cartoon and comic

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Time to strike
First-person shooters splintered near the turn of the millennium. Goldeneye 007, Half-Life, and Halo all had massive impacts on the genre, and their formulas would be the ones imitated for years after. The old key-hunt style of shooter practically died off, only to be revived recently. Now, the indie shooter marketplace is flooded with homages to the pre-3D accelerated years of gaming.
It’s the best time ever to start reassessing games that may have been overlooked. When it comes to leaving no stone unturned, Chasm: The Rift is one of the rockiest. Released in 1997 by Ukrainian developer Action Forms, it wasn’t one I was familiar with. As I looked into it, I saw it referred to as “poor man’s Quake” and “Eurojank.” Yet, those almost seem like terms of endearment, as it does h…
articles.title: Review: Chasm: The Rift

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
Well, I'll be Damned
A brief video posted to the Twitter of developer Grasshopper Manufacture has got fans wondering whether a new, horror-themed title is currently in the works at the No More Heroes studio.  The clip sees a developer hard at work designing a grotesque monster described as an "enemy boss" character.
The "Cultboss" creature — an amalgamation of twisted meat and skulls — looks particularly hellish, which has fans speculating as to whether a new Shadows of the Damned game is in development. Amusingly, asked about their thought process in drawing a 2D image from a completed 3D model, the developer candidly admits that they have "No idea" as they have "never done it before".
https://twitter.com/Grasshopper_EN/status/1581660988910161921?s=20&t=71a7YnTWo3TPJdFznjwUiA
The video itself is a teaser for Grasshopper Manufacture's media output, which includes its "Dev room shorts" videos, in-house documentaries, podcasts, and other behind-the-scenes content. At some point today/tomorrow, the studio will release a brand new interview with its irrepressible founder Goichi Suda — better known to video game fans by his moniker Suda51.  The interview will see the eccentric game designer reflect on titles such as The Silver Case, No More Heroes, and the studio itself.
"WATCH OR DIE!" demands the commercial.  Gee, I guess we better all tune in.
As for the origins of this mysterious monster... I guess we're just going to have to wait and see.
The post Grasshopper Manufacture video shows grotesque ‘boss’ for mystery project appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Grasshopper Manufacture video shows grotesque ‘boss’ for mystery project

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
And only 46 were on the payload
It appears that, right off of the bat, Blizzard Entertainment's decision to go free-to-play with its hero shooter sequel Overwatch 2 has the required effect — The studio has announced that the charismatic multiplayer title has already rocketed past 25 million players in its first 10 days of release.
The number far supersedes that of the original 2016 premium title, which hit around 15 million players during its early launch months.  Blizzard has also noted that daily player counts are already tripling those of the original Overwatch by almost 300%, though what percentage of these players are Reaper mains was not offered up at this time.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LGgqyer-qr4
"The launch of Overwatch 2 has been such an important moment for Blizzard," sai…
articles.title: Overwatch 2 hits 25 million player milestone in 10 days

articles.author: CJ Andriessen
articles.description:
Straight from the horse's mouth
Since the premature death of Silent Hills and the P.T. demo, we've seen a constant stream of supposed leaks and rumors about what will be the next Silent Hill game.  Plenty of people claim to have inside information, but this Wednesday, we'll hear it directly from the people who actually run the show.  Konami dropped word on Sunday that a Silent Hill Transmission will broadcast on October 19 and will feature "the latest updates for the Silent Hill series."
https://twitter.com/Konami/status/1581754864702398464
It's anybody's guess what we'll see in the show, but I'd put my money on Konami pulling back the curtain on that recently uncovered Silent Hill: The Short Message product listing.  Could The Short Message be a new game or a remake of one of the previous games in the series?  Is it that Abandoned game we've all stopped making fun of?  I used the Silent Hill: Shattered Memories key art in the banner image because Sam Barlow mentioned a follow-up to that masterpiece in the past.  And Masahiro Ito seems to be aware of it.  I guess as long as Konami isn't revealing a new pachinko machine, it should be worth tuning in for.
The Silent Hill franchise has been in purgatory for about a decade following the release of Downpour and Book of Memories in 2012.  Hideo Kojima famously tried to take the reigns of the franchise in 2014 with Silent Hills, but following a well-publicized fallout with Konami, he left the company and the project behind to form his own studio.  There have been many rumors of Kojima creating a Silent Hill game over at Kojima Productions, but there's not been anything concrete on that front.
Whatever it is, fans won't have to wait long. The Silent Hill Transmission is set for October 19 at 2:00 pm Pacific.
The post Konami set to reveal the latest on the Silent Hill series this Wednesday appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Konami set to reveal the latest on the Silent Hill series this Wednesday

articles.author: Destructoid Community
articles.description:
Cblogs of 10/8 to 10/14/2022

-Necrowondo thinks that Pokemon is no longer for dedicated video game fans like them.

If you wanna join in on the HOT TAKE party, then head to the Cblogs section, spill your thoughts, and you will find yourself recapped on this here front page next week.

articles.title: How long have you been a dedicated disciple of Pokemon?

articles.author: Chris Moyse
articles.description:
What a week
Good morning, good Saturday, and good weekend, friends, and welcome to Whatcha Been Playing? It's been a hectic week for yer boy, as several members of the good ship Destructoid are indisposed or on vacation, leaving me with a chunky inbox, several important meetings, and some deadlines that seem to be rapidly increasing their approach speed, arriving with the merciless inevitability of an unloved season... I have a lot of work to do, is what I'm saying.
Regardless, it is the weekend, and I hope that this one finds you and yours very well indeed. Be sure to make time for the people and activities that you love, and give yourself a well-earned rest from the week's hardships. And if, like myself, you are working today, then that's cool too. We're all in your corner, and we're roo…
articles.title: Whatcha been playing this week, Destructoid?

articles.author: CJ Andriessen
articles.description:
She's also calling for a boycott of the game
Because we live in an era where so many of the best things in life carry more baggage than a member of the royal family going on a weekend holiday, there are now calls for a boycott of Bayonetta 3 coming from the actor who gave Cereza her voice in the English-speaking world.  As was recently reported, voice actor Jennifer Hale is taking the reins of the title character in this month's big Switch release.  In an interview with Game Informer, Yusuke Miyata, who is directing the series' third entry, said Hale was offered the role because "Various overlapping circumstances made it difficult for Hellena Taylor to reprise her role."  Today, Taylor, who was the English Bayonetta voice actress in the first two games of the series as well as Anarchy Reig…
articles.title: Bayonetta voice actress Hellena Taylor details ‘insulting’ offer to reprise her role in Bayonetta 3

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Forgive me, father
You’re rolling the dice whenever you pick up a game with “Simulator” in the title. Is this going to be an attempt at accurately translating something into a video game, or is it going to abandon all reason and present some sort of unhinged parody? Priest Simulator is definitely in the latter category, but rather than just having some wacky controls that make the whole performance absurd, it goes a few steps further, into a storm drain, and gets washed out to sea.
You technically get up to some priest business in Priest Simulator. One could also argue that you even play as a priest. Maybe my knowledge of priestly happenings is skewed in some way, but if you asked me what a priest does, my answer would be: not this.

Priest Simulator (Steam Early Access)

You play the game…
articles.title: Early Access Review: Priest Simulator

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
To celebrate Dead Space’s 14th anniversary, Motive Studio held a special livestream showcasing its upcoming remake of the game. The presentation featured an extended guided walkthrough showing off new gameplay footage as well as a rundown of features designed to make the game more terrifying than ever. 

The video’s side-by-side comparisons illustrate the major differences between the original and the remake. One big change is that the Ishimura is now a seamless, interconnected ship that players can explore more freely. For example, using Isaac’s rocket thrusters to soar through areas you could only walk through before. A new system called the Intensity Spawn Director remixes necromorph spawn points, ensuring they’ll ambush veteran players in unexpected ways and, sometimes, in greater numbers. Dead Space also features improved necromorph dismemberment, new side quests designed to flesh out the supporting cast, new alternate fire modes for weapons, new puzzles, and more. 

Dead Space launches on January 27 for PlayStation5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.
articles.title: Extended Dead Space Gameplay Walkthrough Runs Down The Remake’s New Features
